Def.Name: White Poplar
Def.Description: Large tree, 39' - 69' in height, rounded to irregular crown with many stout, crooked branches; trunk, sometimes crooked and forked low, growing up to 24" diameter.
Def.Leaves: Alternate, simple, 2 1/2" - 4" long, nearly as wide, palately lobed and most of the time toothed, dark green with white hairs below; red-yellow in autumn.
Def.Twigs: Very light green with white hairs; buds are white and fuzzy.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Capsule, splitting into two parts, both containing numerous seeds with cotton like hairs, capsules grouped in 1 1/2" - 3" catkins, matures in late spring.
Def.Bark: White or gray, smooth, thin; becoming dark green-gray and furrowed.
Def.Range: Hardy to Zone 3a. Introduced from western Asia and Europe.
Def.Remarks: Attractive ornamental with many undesirable traits including: roots that damage drains, sewers and sidewalks.
